item.title: Report E-2023060802
item.description:
Report E-2023060802

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-20T21:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-09
  • City: CONSTANTINE
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SCHNEIDER NATIONAL BULK CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: To be clear, there was nothing wrong with the valves on our trailer, I just didn't know what to flag on number 25. That said our driver hooked up to the right fill line at the customer (nitric acid) but then when he turned around to our trailer he ended up to the wrong compartment which contained sodium hydroxide. He admits that he didn't do a final check like they are trained to do. When he started to unload smoke quickly formed from the customer tank. He shut down. The reaction caused approximately 10 gallons to leak on to the concrete floor. A clean up crew was hired to come in and clean up the floor and empty the tank when the reaction subsided.

item.title: Report E-2023060725
item.description:
Report E-2023060725

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-18T15:09:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-16
  • City: SAGINAW
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XSG experienced the release of UN1993 “Duroct Zinc 8%” from a 350-gallon metal tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived on site and confirmed approximately 1-cup of product released impacting the top of the tote only due to the gasket on the tote breaking. The tote was wiped down and the damaged gasket was replaced with a new one for the tote's shipment onto the consignee. The damaged gasket and absorbent rags were collected and containerized into a 5-gallon poly drum. The waste was left onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Associate who found the item didn't report the issue appropriately. It was found at door 246. DescribePack: The pour cap on the top of the drum wasn't secured sufficiently and was loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: unknown

item.title: Report X-2023061206
item.description:
Report X-2023061206

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-18T15:09:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-15
  • City: PORTAGE
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Drum was found tipped over in trailer 827084 after opening door the trailer had no load net and drum was on its side leaking out a little from the side. Drum was put into a hazmat tote and taken to the hazmat cage where it was found that the tip over bent the lid and popped it off causing the spill. DescribePack: Lid popped off on the sides due to it hitting the flaps of the trailer during transport. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat was put into a tote and taken to hazmat cage at the time of its location.

item.title: Report X-2023061162
item.description:
Report X-2023061162

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-18T15:09:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-14
  • City: LIVONIA
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND LOADED ON A TUGGER CART INCORRECTLY, AS IT WAS LAYING ON ITS SIDE, INSTEAD OF UPRIGHT. IT WAS NOTED THAT THE EXTERIOR WAS DAMP AND LEAKING. WHEN I HANDLED THE PACKAGE, IT WAS LEAKING A PINKISH LIQUID FROM THE BOTTOM. UPON INSPECTION, THE PLASTIC CAP WAS FOUND THREADED INCORRECTLY AND NOT SEALED COMPLETELY. DescribePack: THE EXTERIOR WAS NOT FAULTY. THE PLASTIC CAP THAT WAS MEANT TO BE SEALED PROPERLY, WAS NOT ON CORRECTLY. THE PLASTIC CAP WAS THREADED IMPROPERLY, LEAVING ROOM FOR THE INNER LIQUID TO SEEP OUT IF HANDLED THE WRONG WAY. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS MOVED TO AN UPRIGHT POSITION AND MOVED TO A SECURE AREA.
